content.question: A theme park thrill ride involves a tower and a carriage that rapidly moves passengers up and down along a vertical axis, as shown in the figure. The carriage is lifted to the top of the tower, then released to move down the tower. The ride involves <math alttext="10"><semantics><mn>10</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> controlled bounces from the highest point to the lowest point, and back to the highest point. A point <math alttext="X"><semantics><mi>X</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is located on the bottom of the carriage. The height of <math alttext="X"><semantics><mi>X</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> above the ground, in feet, can be modeled by a periodic function <math alttext="H"><semantics><mi>H</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> seconds, <math alttext="X"><semantics><mi>X</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is at its highest point of <math alttext="120"><semantics><mn>120</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> feet. The lowest point for <math alttext="X"><semantics><mi>X</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is at a height of <math alttext="20"><semantics><mn>20</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> feet. The next time <math alttext="X"><semantics><mi>X</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is at its highest point is at time <math alttext="t equals 8"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> seconds, which is the end of the first bounce. Which of the following can be an expression for <math alttext="H open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is the time in seconds?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="H open parentheses t close parentheses equals 50 sin open parentheses pi over 4 t close parentheses plus 70"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>70</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="H open parentheses t close parentheses equals 50 cos open parentheses pi over 4 t close parentheses plus 70"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>70</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="H open parentheses t close parentheses equals 50 sin open parentheses pi over 8 t close parentheses plus 70"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>8</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>70</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="H open parentheses t close parentheses equals 50 cos open parentheses pi over 8 t close parentheses plus 70"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>8</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>70</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="H open parentheses t close parentheses equals 50 cos open parentheses pi over 4 t close parentheses plus 70"><semantics><mrow><mi>H</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>70</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
